stream_context.summary: Kaze blocks-out the very first overworld section for Return to Yoshi’s Island, experimenting with scale, gating, camera and tutorial elements. He also explains technical changes (a new random function) and outlines upcoming beta-testing and asset reworks.

development_findings.summary: All 15 main courses are finished; current focus is overworld, side levels and integrating Biobak’s visual reworks.
development_findings.quote: We basically just finished course 15, which means all the main courses are done. Now, all that's remaining is some side levels, Biobak's reworks, and the overworld.

development_findings.summary: The overworld will be split into 15 interconnected parts—closer to Banjo-Kazooie than Mario 64 in structure.
development_findings.quote: The overworld is going to be very interconnected… I guess it's more similar to Banjo-Kazooie than Mario 64 in that regard.

development_findings.summary: First overworld segment: player lands at a dock, sees a lighthouse, and is funneled toward Course 2 while Course 1 is initially blocked to create intrigue.
development_findings.quote: I like that there is a target here for the player to be like, okay, I need to go to the target, but I don't like that the player instantly can get there with no suspense whatsoever.

development_findings.summary: Planned gate for Course 1: a Pachyderm NPC blocks the barrel entrance; players either ground-pound it or pay with overworld coins after collecting ~10 coins.
development_findings.quote: What if the elephants somehow blocked it and you have to get rid of the elephants… or pay him off to let you through?

development_findings.summary: Tutorial strategy: a Cheep-Cheep holding a sign appears if the player falls in water, displaying swimming controls.
development_findings.quote: There is a friendly Cheep Cheep in the water here that has a sign that holds up to teach you the swim controls if you are in water.

development_findings.summary: After 2–3 stars an overworld event triggers: a message-in-a-bottle washes ashore, revealing a secret on the ‘lonely palm’ island (extra star).
development_findings.quote: Message in a bottle lands here somewhere and it tells you like a secret… for a star.

development_findings.summary: Camera plan: short cinematic of Mario’s boat docking, then camera pans behind him, ensuring the lighthouse is shown before control begins.
development_findings.quote: When you first enter this overworld, [there’s] a cutscene of Mario's boat approaching… the lighthouse is shown in this cutscene.

development_findings.summary: New PRNG replaces vanilla’s, uses cycle counter noise; outcome is non-deterministic, making traditional tool-assisted speedruns impossible unless emulators change.
development_findings.quote: Every time I load a save-state it's a different one… so I think you can't test this rom-hack.

development_findings.summary: Coins now pursue Mario on spawn (to lessen RNG impact), and other small QoL changes (sleep animations kept, coin count balancing).
development_findings.quote: I made it so that coins chase Mario when they spawn… RNG is a little less impactful in this game.

development_findings.summary: Known bug: Mario’s hat material swaps; Kaze is deferring fix until the final model is locked to avoid duplicate work.
development_findings.quote: Obviously I noticed that there's a bug, and obviously I will fix such a huge bug… I'm just not doing it right now because I might rework the model.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is self-funding the project; paying Biobak alone will cost ‘tens of thousands’ and he may start a donation drive.
context_findings.quote: Yes, Biobak is reworking all the levels and I have to pay him a lot for that. The game as a whole is going to cost me in the tens of thousands.

context_findings.summary: He relies on Patreon, YouTube and sponsorships; two fully-edited videos are on hold pending ad deals to pay his editor.
context_findings.quote: I actually have two videos already… I'm just waiting to be able to insert a sponsor. This is because I have an editor now, and I need to pay the editor.

context_findings.summary: Design philosophy: dislikes ‘grind’ RPG mechanics; values contrast, player intrigue and performance optimisation on original hardware.
context_findings.quote: Contrast is what makes the art… In a world full of unoptimized piece-of-shit games, this one game runs so well it can even run on a Nintendo 64.

biobak.summary: Reworking every level’s graphics; work is large-scale and paid contract.
biobak.quote: Biobak is reworking all the levels and I have to pay him a lot for that.

key_stories.title: Gating Course 1
key_stories.summary: Kaze realizes immediate access to Course 1 kills suspense. He experiments with docks, dunes and camera angles before settling on a Pachyderm gate tied to coin collection or ground-pound discovery.
key_stories.challenge: Players could walk straight into Course 1, reducing exploration.
key_stories.process: Redesigned beach layout, extended dock, tested camera, added dunes for visual blocking, brainstormed NPC gate and coin mechanic.
key_stories.outcome: Decided on Pachyderm blockade + coin/ground-pound unlock; coin placement and Cheep-Cheep tutorial will steer early gameplay.
key_stories.key_quote: I want the player to feel kind of stuck at the beginning… Maybe the elephants block it and you have to get rid of the elephants or pay him.

key_stories.title: True-Noise RNG
key_stories.summary: A faster custom PRNG, based on the N64 cycle counter, produces non-deterministic results. This speeds code but breaks traditional TAS tools.
key_stories.challenge: Vanilla RNG was slow; Kaze wanted better performance.
key_stories.process: Replaced RNG with cycle-counter based function, tested on hardware and emulators; found each savestate reload yields different values.
key_stories.outcome: Decided to keep it despite TAS implications; believes emulator mods will be needed for testing.
key_stories.key_quote: I think you can't test this rom-hack… every time I load a save-state it's a different one.

key_stories.title: Financing Level Reworks
key_stories.summary: Visual overhaul by Biobak is essential but expensive. Kaze commits personal funds, weighs donation drives and sponsorships.
key_stories.challenge: High cost of hiring professional artist for 14+ levels.
key_stories.process: Contracted Biobak, tracks costs, discusses monetisation (Patreon, YouTube, potential donation drive).
key_stories.outcome: Work continues; financial plan still forming.
key_stories.key_quote: The game is going to cost me in the tens of thousands… Maybe I will start a donation drive.
